question.body: Which of the following is not matched with its proper function in the cardiovascular system:

multiple_choice.choice: Skeletal muscle- contractions around major arteries help move blood to the body.
Cardiac muscle- contractions of the heart pump blood to the body.
Smooth muscle- contraction and relaxation allow shunting of blood to where it is needed.

response.feedback: Correct. Skeletal muscle assists the major veins in moving the blood back to the heart.
Incorrect. The cardiac muscle of the heart pumps blood to the rest of the body.
Incorrect. The smooth muscle of the blood vessels is responsible for shunting blood.
